member_organisations:
Eupave - European Concrete Paving Association  http://www.eupave.eu/documents/home.xml?lang=en 
 
BSi - British Standards Institution
fields_of_interest: Budget, Competition, Business and Industry, Single market, Trans-European Networks, Transport
eu_initiatives:
All road restraint systems are tested to EN 1317.  All BBS systems comply with this Standard.   
Under CPR all road restraint systems must be CE marked as there is a European Standard governing their use.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
Eupave - European Concrete Paving Association  http://www.eupave.eu/documents/home.xml?lang=en 
 
BSi - British Standards Institution
goals__remit: The licensing and promotion of road restraint systems which have been tested to European Standard EN 1317.  BBS holds the intellectual property, designs and crash test results which are licensed across the EU to contractors enabling them to construct compliant road restraint systems.  These systems can then be CE marked in accordance with the CPR.
industry_forums:
Through Eupave BBS contributes to relevant presentations such as discussions on road safety. 
On occasions BBS will brief members of the European Parliament individually on topics relating to safety barrier systems.
relevant_communication: BBS is a member of Eupave which promotes concrete paving solutions throughout the EU.  BBS is involved with the technical promotion of its products showing their contribution towards accident reduction in line with EU policy.  BBS supports promotional events and provides technical literature wherever appropriate.
